intro: Myobroma subspinescens, commonly known as the spiny myobroma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which are often covered in small spines. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
